Instruction: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Gently grease two baking sheets.
Spoon dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing the mounds about 2 inches apart.
Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are golden brown, about 10 minutes. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are browned, approximately 5 minutes.

Take the baked wafers off the baking sheet one at a time using a spatula or kitchen turner. Roll each wafer around the handle of a wooden spoon until the edges overlap. Cool with the seam side down on a wire rack until they are completely crisp.
